subject: Creativity
title: Phobias and Imagination: Fear of Things That Aren't There
description: A short lesson to help you apply Phobias and Imagination: Fear of Things That Aren't There.

hook.text: A person with arachnophobia panics at a rubber spider. Their imagination hijacks the threat-detection system.

buildup.text: The amygdala can't tell real threats from vividly imagined ones. A mental image of danger triggers real fear.

discovery.text: Brain scans show phobic responses activate the same circuits as actual encounters with the feared object.

punchline.text: Phobias prove that imagination writes the body's fear script.
